channel.title: Linux on PS3
channel.description: Has anyone here done it? i'm thinking about doing it but i wasn't sure so if anyone got some suggestions/ tips would be glad to hear em

item.title: Linux on PS3
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You can switch Hard drives out for one thing. And no, you can’t change your Boot Parameters without first installing a Mod Chip. No wait, I don’t think that is true, I think you can boot from a usb stick.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux on PS3

item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

I’ve done this, lol, Fedora, it made me lol, it’s a disaster, the number of PowerPC compatible programs is hilarious

Read full topic

item.title: Linux on PS3
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:210776”]I have Xubuntu installed on mine, it was a little tricky, and might be close to impossible if you have no other prior linux experience. I got some info from psubuntu.com but most of it turned out to be wrong and I ended up compiling my own kboot, kernel and ps3 utils anyway, I uploaded them in case you want to give it a shot, but no guarantees are provided of course:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/ps3/

The latest version of Stella is in there too, it’s great fun to play 30 year old games on a PS3. Goodluck, have fun. ;)[/quote]
Thanks i will take a good look at those also i was unaware you had a PS3 do you have PSN?

Read full topic

item.title: Linux on PS3
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I have Xubuntu installed on mine, it was a little tricky, and might be close to impossible if you have no other prior linux experience. I got some info from psubuntu.com but most of it turned out to be wrong and I ended up compiling my own kboot, kernel and ps3 utils anyway, I uploaded them in case you want to give it a shot, but no guarantees are provided of course:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/ps3/

The latest version of Stella is in there too, it’s great fun to play 30 year old games on a PS3. Goodluck, have fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux on PS3
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:2, topic:210776”]Well sonys stupid partitioning software ruins it slightly since, say you had a 60gb hdd it would only let you partition it 10gb / 50gb. So you need to choose what gets the 10gb partition, the standard os or linux.

Yellow dog linux (The version sony funded to get it specifically ported to ps3) works under HD so thats one plus to having that version of linux. What i used to have on mine is that and the only plus i found is being able to sit in bed with a wireless keyboard and mouse on a 32" TV on the internet, irc etc.

Sony originally said they would going to package linux with the console, but as the console was expensive enough as it was they didn’t. Oh and if you plan on using Yellow dog linux then you’re best torrenting it because it does cost money to buy it legally.[/quote]
2 things 1) SDFU HOMO 2) how much it cost?

Read full topic

item.title: Linux on PS3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well sonys stupid partitioning software ruins it slightly since, say you had a 60gb hdd it would only let you partition it 10gb / 50gb. So you need to choose what gets the 10gb partition, the standard os or linux.

Yellow dog linux (The version sony funded to get it specifically ported to ps3) works under HD so thats one plus to having that version of linux. What i used to have on mine is that and the only plus i found is being able to sit in bed with a wireless keyboard and mouse on a 32" TV on the internet, irc etc.

Sony originally said they would going to package linux with the console, but as the console was expensive enough as it was they didn’t. Oh and if you plan on using Yellow dog linux then you’re best torrenting it because it does cost money to buy it legally.

Read full topic
